means: 潇洒的，从容的，无拘束的

sentence.Network_en: Rather degage after the nervousness he had shown at dinner.
sentence.Network_cn: 在宴会上,他经过最初的一阵紧张过后,显得相当从容.

sentence.Network_en: However, no one can be so degage that he forgets all completely.
sentence.Network_cn: 可是, 没有人能忘得一干二净而又如此潇洒.

sentences.sentence: "rather degage after the nervousness he had shown at dinner"- Edmund Wilson

"she may be detached or even unfeeling but at least she's not hypocritically effusive"

auth_sentence.content: The revolution is in danger, one man warned as others shouted the slogan that dominated protests two years ago: RCD degage!
